meanings.definition: A thing that is seen as the best or most attractive example of a particular type of thing
meanings.sent1: The cake was a showpiece at the party, everyone admired its beauty.
meanings.sent2: The museum's prized painting is a showpiece of the collection.
meanings.sent3: The showpiece of the garden was the colorful fountain that delighted visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her talent in playing the piano was a showpiece that left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The showpiece of the fashion show was the stunning evening gown that sparkled under the lights.

meanings.definition: A piece of work that is intended to be shown to the public and that is the best or most important work of an artist, writer, etc.
meanings.sent1: The artist's latest sculpture was a showpiece at the gallery, drawing many admirers.
meanings.sent2: The final chapter of the novel was the showpiece that tied the whole story together.
meanings.sent3: The chef's showpiece dessert was a tower of chocolate that looked too good to eat.
meanings.sent4: The showpiece of the concert was the musician's breathtaking solo performance.
meanings.sent5: The showpiece of the exhibition was the intricate mosaic that took months to create.
